title: Question for RIOT about lore, please respond :)
body:
Just regarding the Lore of Twisted fate/Graves, when Kalista was teased, her black mist was on Twisted Fate's page signalling that he was a Traitor, but now it is revealed that he did all he could to save Graves, and thus didn't betray him, so does that mean:

A. That the black mist didn't actually happen on Twisted Fate's page, and Kalista was never hunting Twisted Fate.

B. Kalista was mistaken and sent the black mist to an innocent person, and has now realised her mistake and no longer hunts Twisted Fate.

C. Once targeted by the mist even if you're innocent like Twisted Fate, Kalista can not call off the hunt.

D. Does not sacrificing your own life after you have already tried everything else to save your friend, still count as betrayal in the eyes of Kalista and she still hunts Twisted Fate.

E. Insert own answer.

Twisted Fate is one of my favourite champs and i really love reading all the lore about them and their interactions, Azir is my Main champ and he is has a whole library of lore surrounding him, and I'm so glad that Twisted Fate does now as well, but just like how the Arival of Azir re-wrote a lot of lore, i was wondering if this was the same with Kalista's interaton with Twisted Fate.

replies.body:
Though Twisted Fate didn't see it as a betrayal, Graves certainly did at the time, and, frankly, for good reason. Though TF might have seen it as the only way out, Graves trusted their ability to get out of virtually any situation, if they stuck together.

To Graves, at that moment, the person he trusted the most to back him in any situation absolutely betrayed that trust.

They're just two different people whose flaws tore them apart because they didn't really understand each other. By the end of Burning Tides: The Reckoning, that isn't the case. Well, not as much anyway.

And hello!

Hey thanks for replying! :)
ah ok that makes sense!
So with Kalista's vengeance it doesn't matter if they actually betrayed the other person or not, its just if the other person thinks they have?
so if someone pretended to be me and played a trick on one of my friends, my friend would think it was me and Kalista would have valid reason to hunt me down? 

but if it does work on the basis of what they betrayee 'feels' or 'thinks' happened, not what actually happened, how does Kalista know that someone thinks/feels that? does that mean that graves actually actively called upon lady vengeance? so does that mean that Sivir, Azir and Shen all called upon lady vengeance too, so do the souls of 4 champs actually belong to Kalista now?

and now that graves knows the truth that TF did all he could (short of dying) and that they are on better terms now can he reverse the deal and call off the hunt, or is the soul bond a fixed thing and both Graves and TF are doomed now regardless because of those actions?

Also Graves doesn't seem the type to call for help from a spirit, it even showed in burning tides that he was afraid that TF would be killed by his leap off the bridge or by GP's minions, he didnt want to be robbed of the kill, which is what Kalista would do.

Also on that note, Azir is far too proud to call for help, and Shen believes Zed can be redeemed so its odd to send a spectre of revenge after him to kill him. so it seems contradictory to their personalities to call forth Kalista.

sorry for all the questions, I'm just trying to understand how it all fits together.

Kalista operates very specifically on an intentional bond forged by the individual who has been betrayed. However, I think Kalista, as the Spear of Vengeance, knows the underlying truth of whether there is a deserved response when she is called (usually it is, because someone is willing to spend their last breath to invoke her).

Malcolm would never have called upon her to exact his vengeance upon TF. He wanted to do that himself, partly out of pure rage and partly because he needed to understand why his friend did what he did.

Also, I wouldn't take the tease for Kalista too literally, though it does bring up a lot of interesting possibilities about relationships between various Champs and there are certainly elements of betrayal in those who were highlighted.

No reason to apologize for the questions, it's great to discuss these things.

Ahh ok I see, thanks so much for taking the time to explain :)
And I also agree totally with what DiamondAries is saying, it's amazing all the effort that goes into making these lore events, I'm still hyped about the Azir/shurima one and this bilgewater one rivals even that! It's great to see all the interactions between the champs and having all the content like skins and icons to go with it! It really adds so much life into the game (not that there wasn't already tho) 

also the way the story was written was really really well done! I read a lot of fiction books and most of them aren't anywhere near the standard of writing that this was, just the way everything was described and how the perspectives of each character interweaves into the story was perfect, so if you know whoever wrote it could you pass on my thanks to them If it's not too much trouble. 

the people behind the scenes that do all this work that we take for granted definetly deserve more credit from is than they get, 
But id love to know if the person who wrote it has written any novels, because I'd love to read them, 
Perhaps they could write one for LoL itself, like the assassins creed franchise did, and it could tell the detailed story's or side story's of some of the champs.

That's very kind of you to say so. It's been very humbling for us to view the response and it just makes us want to strive for more and better content for you all.

> also the way the story was written was really really well done! I read a lot of fiction books and most of them aren't anywhere near the standard of writing that this was, just the way everything was described and how the perspectives of each character interweaves into the story was perfect, so if you know whoever wrote it could you pass on my thanks to them If it's not too much trouble.

Wow, that's wonderful of you to say so. Burning Tides: The Reckoning was written by a team that included a senior writer whose red name I can't bloody remember, Ant in Oz (yup, an Australian), John O'Dyin, and myself (a whingeing pom!), with editing provided by JohnnyRedactor and FamilyJules, and production support from another Rioter whose red name escapes me (I'll follow up with them). The original story breaking session and outline included a few additional folks, including WaaaarghBobo (principal writer on Tahm Kench and Rek'Sai) and a couple of other talented Rioters. So, as you can see, the story alone was quite the team effort. Then add on the amazing art, the game designers, visual designers, production and so on, and it's obvious just how big an undertaking the event was.

It's an inspiration to work with so many talented people, I tell you.

> the people behind the scenes that do all this work that we take for granted definitely deserve more credit from is than they get,
> But id love to know if the person who wrote it has written any novels, because I'd love to read them,
> Perhaps they could write one for LoL itself, like the assassins creed franchise did, and it could tell the detailed story's or side story's of some of the champs.

We're not big on taking credit, that comes from just bringing value to the players. The writers who worked on The Reckoning come from a variety of backgrounds (novelists, television writers, a journalist, video game writers, table top game writers etc.)

There are a variety of ways we want to bring more story to players. I'll just leave it at that.

Thanks again for the kind words.

Thanks so much for bringing everything together and creating this for us! we do really appreciate it!  its inspiring
and pass our thanks on to the rest of your team as well :) 
ist amazing that so many people with such varied backgrounds have the opportunity to work together on a project like this. id love to get into game design, not the programming, but the design of lore and characters. hopefully one day maybe even at RIOT haha but I'm pretty sure thats the dream of everyone else here too haha 

and i hope to see what comes next, It'd be cool to see ionia and have the rift all in cherry blossoms etc and see how yasuo's tale plays out, but whatever it is i cant wait!

Don't know if this is where I should say it by I really think that what Riot are doing right now with their "lore story" thing is amazing. While some champions have fantastic lores, they all seem static. But this event that is going on now is just so dynamic and really brings the characters to life. I commend Riot for this idea and whoever came up with it deserves a prize.

That's most kind of you to say so. It was very much a team effort (the Event overall had many people from various teams across Riot involved). We certainly want to drive more story that shows our Champions in the world interacting, growing and changing. Having Twisted Fate, Graves, Gangplank, and Miss Fortune all undergo defining changes was a key goal for the story team and for the event as a whole.
Stories inherently are about seeing people change due to their choices. 
We want to continue to tell those stories.
Well I for one fully support this motion and cannot wait to see more of this for other champs.
